alert.note: Alert for Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 5:58PM EDT until August 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Otsego County in central New York... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain has already fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring in Edmeston and Hartwick. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cooperstown, Hartwick, Edmeston, Pittsfield, New Berlin, Milford, Bowerstown, Westville, Burlington, Index, Toddsville, South Edmeston and Lambs Corners. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
